description: This interdisciplinary course examines the ties that bind Africans and African Americans. Africans on the African continent and in the diaspora share historical, cultural, and religious lives that prove richly diverse. Students explore ways that peoples of Africian descent interact. From colonial times to the present day whether in the New World, or in Africa their lives intersect to create institutions and powerful influences in the world. Counts toward American studies major and race and ethnic studies major and concentration.
name: Sem: Africa/Americas

revisions.desc: This seminar examines the African background of African Americans and ties between Africa and African Americans. It examines the nature of interaction and the role played by Africans,African culture, and African institutions in the political, economic, cultural and religious life ofthe New World. Students explore questions such as to what extent the iconography of Africa so usedto mobilize Africans in disperson, and how effective was the consciousness of Africa sustained inthe New World and finally the contributions of African Americans to Africa.

title: Africa and the Americas: The Diaspora Experience
